parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Genitive Feminine Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
From sustrepho; a twisting together, i.e. a secret coalition, riotous crowd.

word: and bound themselves with an oath
parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To curse, invoke curses, devote to destruction. From anathema; to declare or vow under penalty of execration.
Nor, neither, not even, neither?nor. From me and te; not too, i.e. neither or nor; also, not even.
Nor, neither, not even, neither?nor. From me and te; not too, i.e. neither or nor; also, not even.
To drink, imbibe. A prolonged form of pio, which poo occurs only as an alternate in certain tenses; to imbibe.
A conjunction, preposition and adverb of continuance, until.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To put to death, kill; fig: I abolish. From apo and kteino; to kill outright; figuratively, to destroy.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.
